gw.api.database.upgrade.before

Class IBeforeUpgradeTable

  • gw.api.database.upgrade.before.IBeforeUpgradeTable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IBeforeUpgradeReadOnlyTable

    public class IBeforeUpgradeTable
implements IBeforeUpgradeReadOnlyTable

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class gw.api.database.upgrade.before.IBeforeUpgradeReadOnlyTable

        Name

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IBeforeUpgradeTable alterMultipleColumnsToMatchDatamodel(IBeforeUpgradeColumn[] columnNames)
      More efficient operation that allows altering the type (but not nullability) of multiple columns in one operation. Some databases don't support this, so multiple operations will be performed.
      IBeforeUpgradeTable create()
      Only works if table does not exist and is backed by an entity type
      IBeforeUpgradeTable createAllIndexes()
      Creates all indexes on this table. To be more precise, this method will also drop unnecessary indexes. Due to the renaming of indexes (the prefix stays the same, but the suffix changes), the situation may arise where we may not be able to create an index because of a name conflict. To be consistent, we drop all unnecessary indexes when we create new ones. In other words, the net result of calling this method is that the table will be in the expected state with regards to indexes.
      IBeforeUpgradeTable createAsNewTempTable(Pair<F,S>[] Pair<String, IDataType>[])
      IBeforeUpgradeTable createIndex(boolean unique, String[] columnNames)
      Create a non-clustered, non-spatial index on the given columns. All keys are sorted in ascending order. The intent is that this index would be temporary
      IBeforeUpgradeTable createNewTempTableBasedOnCurrentSchema()
      Creates a new table based on this table's schema in the database. This table must be associated with an entity and must also exist in the database. Note that the returned temp table will contain the columns that this table has in the database right now, and the columns may not match those specified in the entity metadata. For example the metadata might contain a new column that is not yet created (because of an add or rename), or might not contain a column that is yet to be deleted/renamed. This method is usually more appropriate than {@link #createNewTempTableBasedOnThis()} if you are about to copy data from this table into the new temp table as you know the columns will match exactly.
      IBeforeUpgradeTable createNewTempTableBasedOnThis()
      Creates a new table based on this table's entity metadata. The table must be associated with an entity. Columns that did not exist in this table are not created on the temp table, even if the metadata defines such a column. Note that this table may not contain columns that are going to be renamed because the metadata will reflect the new name for the column but will not have an entry for the old name, so it will not be added to the temp table. Consider {@link #createNewTempTableBasedOnCurrentSchema()} if you are creating a temp table which will be used to copy all the data from an existing table.
      IBeforeUpgradeTable createPrimaryKey()
      Creates the primary key for this table, if one is defined
      IBeforeUpgradeColumn createTempColumn(String columnName, IDataType columnDataType)
      Creates a new nullable column with the given name and datatype to hold temporary data. Note that the user must explicitly drop the temp column. The schema verifier will catch if the user did not drop it.
      IBeforeUpgradeDeleteBuilder delete()
      IBeforeUpgradeTable drop()
      Includes dropping the foreign keys from this to others
      IBeforeUpgradeTable dropAllFKs()
      Drops all foreign keys from this table to other tables
      IBeforeUpgradeTable dropAllFKsToMe()
      Drops all foreign keys to this table
      IBeforeUpgradeTable dropAllIndexes()
      Drops all indexes on this table
      IBeforeUpgradeTable dropColumns(IBeforeUpgradeColumn[] columns)
      More efficient operation that allows dropping multiple columns in one operation. Some databases don't support this, so multiple operations will be performed.
      IBeforeUpgradeTable dropPrimaryKey()
      Drops the primary key
      IBeforeUpgradeColumn getColumn(String columnName)
      IBeforeUpgradeInsertBuilder insert()
      IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder insertSelect(IBeforeUpgradeTable sourceTable)
      IBeforeUpgradeInsertSelectBuilder insertSelect(IBeforeUpgradeSelectBuilder sourceQuery)
      IBeforeUpgradeTable rename(String newTableName)
      Renames a table to the given name
      IBeforeUpgradeTable truncate()
      Truncates this table. This will fail if referencing foreign keys aren't satisfied.
      IBeforeUpgradeUpdateBuilder update()
      IBeforeUpgradeTable updateStatistics()
      Updates statistics on the table. Note that statistics will again be updated as part of the automated portion of the upgrade.

      • Methods inherited from class gw.api.database.upgrade.before.IBeforeUpgradeReadOnlyTable

        exists, existsInDatamodel, getColumn, query

Due to the renaming of indexes (the prefix stays the same, but the suffix changes), the situation may arise where we may not be able to create an index because of a name conflict. To be consistent, we drop all unnecessary indexes when we create new ones. In other words, the net result of calling this method is that the table will be in the expected state with regards to indexes.

      • createNewTempTableBasedOnCurrentSchema

        IBeforeUpgradeTable createNewTempTableBasedOnCurrentSchema()
        Creates a new table based on this table's schema in the database. This table must be associated with an entity and must also exist in the database. Note that the returned temp table will contain the columns that this table has in the database right now, and the columns may not match those specified in the entity metadata. For example the metadata might contain a new column that is not yet created (because of an add or rename), or might not contain a column that is yet to be deleted/renamed.

        This method is usually more appropriate than {@link #createNewTempTableBasedOnThis()} if you are about to copy data from this table into the new temp table as you know the columns will match exactly.

        Returns:
        a new object representing the temp table

      • createNewTempTableBasedOnThis

        IBeforeUpgradeTable createNewTempTableBasedOnThis()
        Creates a new table based on this table's entity metadata. The table must be associated with an entity. Columns that did not exist in this table are not created on the temp table, even if the metadata defines such a column. Note that this table may not contain columns that are going to be renamed because the metadata will reflect the new name for the column but will not have an entry for the old name, so it will not be added to the temp table. Consider {@link #createNewTempTableBasedOnCurrentSchema()} if you are creating a temp table which will be used to copy all the data from an existing table.
        Returns:
        a new object representing the temp table

        Returns:
